bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Currier McEwen, September 20, 1951

div1.p: Hench hopes that the telegram sent for New York University's commemoration of the centennial of Reed's birth was satisfactory. He offers to send a photograph of Reed's Bellevue medical diploma to McEwen.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Currier McEwen, September 20, 1951
div1.opener:
September 20, 1951
Dr. Currier McEwen, Dean
New York University College of Medicine
477 First Avenue
New York 16, New York
My dear Currier:
div1.p:
I hope that the telegram which Mr. John Wheldon asked me to send on
the occasion of Walter Reed's 100th birthday party at your institution
was satisfactory.

There is one piece of unfinished business. It is curious that some of
the dates of Walter Reed's early educational activities are clouded.
Fortunately for me I have his actual diplomas presented to me by the
Reed family. Mr. Wheldon spoke of Reed as a member of the class of '97.
This was obviously an error. Later he corrected it and stated it was
of the class of Bellevue '73. As per my letter to Dr. Jacobson, published
in the Brooklyn Hospital Journal, April-June, 1949, page 83, I was under
the impression that Reed graduated from Bellevue on October 1, 1872, not
1873. After sending you the wire, I checked on this. I have his Bellevue
diploma in my safe and without question he got his second degree of doctor
of medicine from Bellevue on October 1, 1872, regardless of what he may or
may not have continued to do at Bellevue.

Does your institution have a photograph of this diploma? Would you like
to have one? I should be glad to have a photograph of it made for you
and present it to you or to the institution or both with my best wishes
(but I do think that the Bellevue records should be corrected). In return
for it I would like to know what he might have done in 1873, if he continued
some activity there.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
P.S.: I have just received your letter of September 14. Thank you very
much for your kind thoughts regarding our daughter Mary. The wedding was
very nice.
